(Sorry I hadn't posted yesterday. There was a big storm and we lost power.)

Tavatron:

The artificial lights reflected off of her optics, giving them an almost glowing appearence. Hunting, outdoors, with live prey... she hadn't done that in ages. Tavatron absentmindedly scratched her wrist, a somewhat nervous look on her face. She turned her head to the side and thought for a moment. Did she really want to go through it again?

Tavatron's mind flashed back to a time when things had been calmer, more... peaceful. Herself and a pack of fellow wolves had gone hunting, only she had been unable to 'pull her own weight' so to speak. 

They had groaned and whispered behind her back everytime she had snapped a branch, or gone left when she should have gone right. There was also the time she had slipped off a bank and fallen into a river, but she preferred not to think about that.

The bottom line was, despite her appearence, she was a lousy huntress. Tavatron cleared her throat and regained her composure. She wasn't one for admitting her weaknesses:

"Very well, we shall hunt."
